page.title: 05 Grafton Underwood
page.content: Grafton Underwood is 4 miles east of Kettering. The village runs north south and is almost half a kilometre from one end to the other. A stream runs along the west side of the street and people have to cross the footbridges to get to their homes. The houses are old and mainly made of stone with a few made of brick. Most of the roofs are made of thatch, but some are made of tile and slate. Most of the houses have very pretty gardens and many people grow their own vegetables. There is one shop in the village and two farms very close to the village. There is a small village hall built of wood.
